pr_title: Update to latest version of dependencies

timeline.message: Update to latest version of dependencies.
Merge branch 'update-dependencies' of github.com:ajsutton/teku into update-dependencies
Downgrade javalin again, it brings in a bunch of challenging dependencies that we'll have to more carefully check licenses for.

timeline.bodyText: Are we enforced now to specify any internal classes this way?
timeline.author: Nashatyrev

replies.bodyText: Not all internal classes - error prone has a rule to prevent importing classes or methods with overly generic names.  It used to mostly hit me on Builder but has apparently been expanded to include Entry and valueOf.  I can live with it but it would be very easy to convince me to just disable the whole rule as I can't think of a time when it wasn't obvious which Builder was meant in context.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Is it something which is enforced now?
timeline.author: Nashatyrev

replies.bodyText: Yes. It's technically right that there's no point having a public constructor for an abstract class but I'm not sure I care. If it gets annoying I'd be happy to disable it.  I just generally try to minimise the number of rules we disable unless there's a real reason to.
replies.author: ajsutton
